instruction: 你需要总结出chat_history里的每一条事实信息（fact），越精简越好。按照模板：{"facts": ["",]} 输出内容。

chat_history: John: Mary, we've been arguing a lot lately, we need to talk about it.
Mary: What do you want to talk about now? I'm tired of arguing all the time.
John: Sweetheart, please don't be like this. I know we've both been a bit short-tempered lately, but that doesn't mean I don't love you anymore.
Mary: You love me? But lately, you've been so distant and cold, barely talking to me.
John: I'm sorry, I've been under a lot of work pressure lately, so I've been in a bad mood. But I promise, I really do love you.
Mary: Sorry won't cut it. You always say that, but then it's back to the same old. Even my mom suggests I break up with you.
John: Please don't listen to your mom. It's been hard for us to get together, we can't just throw it all away.
Mary: Then what do you suggest? I'm really tired, and I don't know if we can keep going like this.
John: I can't promise anything else, but I promise you, I'll change. I won't ignore you or get mad for no reason anymore.
Mary: Really? You won't deceive me again? Last time you said the same, but then you broke your promise.
John: I absolutely won't this time! Give me another chance, okay? I bought movie tickets, let's go watch a movie and relax.
Mary: Fine, you're so sweet-talking. But okay, for the sake of the movie, I'll give you another chance.
John: That's great! I knew my Mary is the kindest. Come on, the movie is about to start, I'll buy you some popcorn.
Mary: Spare me, how good can the cinema popcorn be? But for your sincerity, I'll reluctantly agree.
John: Understood! I promise to make you happy every day from now on, and never make you angry again.
Mary: Enough of your sweet talk. Come on, the movie is about to start.
Mary: Just you? Forget it, last time you almost set the kitchen on fire. I don't want to eat your cooking.
John: No no no, this time I've done my homework. I'll make you taste my culinary skills.
Mary: Fine, I'll reluctantly give it a try. But if you make another dark dish, I won't be polite.
John: Don't worry, darling, this time you'll be impressed! Let's go watch the movie first, and I'll let you taste my cooking tonight.

facts: John and Mary have been arguing frequently lately, their relationship is in crisis
John takes the initiative to talk to Mary, trying to repair the relationship
Mary suggests breaking up, feeling tired, unsure if they can continue
John begs Mary for another chance, promises not to ignore or get angry at her anymore
John buys movie tickets to cheer up Mary, Mary reluctantly agrees to reconcile
John suggests cooking a meal for Mary to showcase his culinary skills, Mary reluctantly agrees to try

instruction: 你需要总结出chat_history里的每一条事实信息（fact），越精简越好。按照模板：{"facts": ["",]} 输出内容。

chat_history: Alex: Mary, there's something I want to tell you.
Mary: What is it? Hurry up, I have things to do.
Alex: Well... I was wondering if we could... if we could go out for dinner or something...
Mary: Dinner? With you?
Alex: Yeah... I know I'm not good enough for you, but I really like you, ever since the first time I saw you...
Mary: Alright alright, spare me the cheesy lines. Just going out for dinner, it's not like I'm asking you to confess your love.
Alex: Ah? So you mean... you agree?
Mary: It's just dinner, don't get ahead of yourself. I've been too busy and tired lately, and since you're treating, I'll give you face.
Alex: That's great! Don't worry, I'll definitely treat you to a good meal. Whatever you want to eat, just order!
Mary: What to eat doesn't matter, just don't pick something too expensive. I don't want to owe you any favors.
Alex: How could that be? I'm just happy to have dinner with you. How about... we go to that newly opened Western restaurant? I heard the ambiance is nice.
Mary: Sure, I haven't been there before. But don't get the wrong idea, I'm just there to try the new dishes.
Alex: Of course, of course, you can interpret it however you like. How about this Saturday night at 7 o'clock downstairs at the company?
Mary: Alright, don't be late. I don't wait for people.
Alex: Don't worry, I'll be there early. Oh, after dinner, we could go watch a movie or something...
Mary: After dinner, I'm going home. No movie. I said, just dinner.
Alex: Ah, okay, okay, I'll go along with whatever you say. Let's discuss after dinner.
Mary: Okay, I have to go now. See you on Saturday.
Alex: Alright... see you on Saturday. Take care on your way.
Mary: I know, I'm not a three-year-old. Bye.
Alex: Bye... ah, Mary is really aloof, but it's okay, I finally managed to ask her out. I need to prepare well, can't mess this up!
Mary: Such a silly boy. Oh well, I guess I'll help him out, just one meal, that's it.

facts: Alex is a nerdy programmer who has been secretly in love with Mary, the aloof goddess of the company
Alex gathers the courage to ask Mary out for dinner, to his surprise, Mary agrees
Mary clarifies that it's just dinner, doesn't imply anything else, doesn't want to owe any favors
The two agree to have dinner at a newly opened Western restaurant this Saturday night
Alex suggests watching a movie after dinner, but Mary refuses, insisting on just dinner
Alex is happy to finally ask Mary out, resolves to prepare well for the date

instruction: 你需要总结出chat_history里的每一条事实信息（fact），越精简越好。按照模板：{"facts": ["",]} 输出内容。

chat_history: Jane: I've had enough of you! We've been married for so many years, and you've never cared about me!
John: That's nonsense! When haven't I cared about you? I work hard every day for this family!
Jane: Work hard? All you care about is making money. Have you ever cared about my feelings?
John: I make money to give you a good life! What more do you want?
Jane: I don't need your money! I want your care and love, but you never understand!
John: I don't understand? Do you know how much I've sacrificed for this family? Don't you appreciate it at all?
Jane: Enough! I don't want to hear your excuses anymore! You've never loved me!
John: What did you say? How could you say that? Haven't I loved you enough?
Jane: Where have you loved me? I'm not important to you at all! You only care about yourself!
John: You're being unreasonable! I've tried so hard for this family, what more do you want from me?
Jane: I don't want anything from you, I just want a husband who truly loves me. But obviously, you're not him!
John: Fine, you don't want anything from me, right? Then let's get a divorce! I'm tired of your unreasonable behavior!
Jane: Divorce? Fine, let's do it! Let's see how well you'll do without me!
John: Don't regret it! I won't tolerate your tantrums anymore! I'm going to start over with my life!
Jane: Fine, I won't regret it! Without you, I can still live well!
John: Good, let's go through with the divorce! Do whatever you want from now on!
Jane: Great! I'll pack my things and leave right away! Don't ever come looking for me again!
John: Do I need to look for you? Leave! I don't need you!
Jane: You're the one who needs to leave! Get out now!
John: Fine! This house is yours! I'm leaving, and I won't ever come back!
Jane: Leave! I never want to see you again! Sob... idiot...
John: You won't regret it... goodbye, my ex-wife!

facts: John and his wife Jane have been married for many years, but recently their relationship has hit a rough patch
Jane complains that John doesn't care enough about her, always prioritizes making money
John feels he has sacrificed a lot for the family, feels unfairly treated
The two have a big argument, accusing each other of not loving enough
Jane asks John to leave immediately, John leaves angrily, vowing not to return
The two ultimately decide to divorce, ending their marriage
